author: Agencia Noticias Argentinas
title: Alerta hoy por lluvias fuertes: una provincia afectada
text: Alerta hoy por lluvias fuertes: una provincia afectada El Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional manten√≠a sus avisos para este viernes por fuertes precipitaciones. Se prev√© que la semana cierre con mal clima en diferentes partes del pa√≠s, y por eso el Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional (SMN) manten√≠a alertas por lluvias fuertes en zonas del sur del pa√≠s. De esta forma, rige este viernes un alerta amarillo para zonas de la provincia de Tierra del Fuego. Alerta amarillo por lluvias fuertes De acuerdo con el reporte del organismo, ‚Äúel √°rea ser√° afectadas por lluvias de variada intensidad. Se esperan valores de precipitaci√≥n acumulada entre 10 y 15 mm, que pueden ser superados de forma puntual. En zonas m√°s altas, la precipitaci√≥n podr√≠a presentarse en forma de lluvia y nieve mezclada". Recomendaciones del SMN por lluvias fuertes - Evit√° actividades al aire libre. - No saques la basura. Retir√° objetos que impidan que el agua escurra. - Quedate lejos de zonas costeras y ribere√±as. - Mantenete informado por las autoridades. Ten√© siempre lista una mochila de emergencias con linterna, radio, documentos y tel√©fono.

author: TNN
title: BJP faces challenge in Jangalmahal | Kolkata News - Times of India
text: KOLKATA: The BJP, which had a stellar rise in the Jangalmahal area in West Bengal since 2019, faced a decline in support base in 2024 Lok Sabha polls. While two Lok Sabha candidates from Bankura and Jhargram lost to Trinamool, the party could not even ensure leads from the six assembly constituencies it had won in 2021.In the 2021 assembly poll, the BJP could wrest nine assembly segments in Jangalmahal area comprising Purulia, Jhargram and Bankura. During the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, it lost from Balarampur, Joypur and Kashipur assembly in Purulia and Saltora, Chhatna and Raghunathpur in Bankura. The breather in the Jangalmahal area came only from Baghmundi, where it managed to gain lead despite losing the assembly seat in 2021.‚ÄúThe BJP had started losing its support base since the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. Meanwhile we started working extensively among the people in these three districts. That has helped us increase our support in the area,‚Äù said Tanmay Ghosh, Trinamool Congress‚Äô spokesperson said. In Purulia, BJP could wrest five assembly seats from the Trinamool in the 2021 assembly poll. The margin for the four assembly segments were however thin, ranging between 4,000 and 7,000 votes. In Balarampur, BJP won marginally by 500 seats. In the Panchayat polls, the Trinamool managed to increase seats at the gram panchayat. At the 2023 panchayat poll, Trinamool‚Äôs vote share in Purulia increased by 12%, while the BJP‚Äôs vote share in the gram panchayats nearly halved from 2018 levels.Jhargram, which had seen nearly 35% increase in the BJP‚Äôs vote share in 2019 Lok Sabha polls, witnessed a decline in votes share in the 2021 assembly polls. Its vote share in 2019 Lok Sabha polls was at 44.56%--nearly 2% higher than what it got in 2018 panchayat poll for the district. In the 2019 assembly polls BJP‚Äôs vote share came down further across seven assembly segments to 37.15% in 2021. In the 2023 Panchayat poll, the party‚Äôs vote share for gram panchayat seats came down further to 12.81%.BJP‚Äôs minister Subhas Sarkar who won from Bankura with a margin of nearly 1.75 lakh votes in 2019 Lok Sabha polls, received . In the 2021 assembly polls, BJP managed to win in four out of seven assembly segments including Sarkar‚Äôs hometown Bankura. However, the BJP‚Äôs vote share dipped by 6% from 2019 to 2021. In the 2023 panchayat poll, its votes dipped further to 17.64% in the district.

organizations.name: kolkata news - times of india kolkata

author: Bruce Houghton
title: TikTok refreshes Desktop App in challenge to YouTube
text:
TikTok refreshes Desktop App in challenge to YouTube
TikTok refreshes Desktop App, in the latest salvo in its ongoing battle with YouTube.
TikTok refreshes Desktop App in challenge to YouTube
The new web-based TikTok.com app brings popular in-app functionalities to the web. Updates and new features include a modular layout, a new Explore tab, immersive full-screen live gaming, a refreshed For You feed and a Floating Player.
Now available globally, highlights include:
- Immersive Modular Design: Discover content through an optimized modular layout that features a repositioned navigation bar and reduces distractions offering a more immersive viewing experience and seamless feed exploration.
- LIVE Gaming Streaming: Go LIVE in portrait or landscape mode, delivering a full-screen horizontal view for desktop users, while mobile users can simply rotate their devices to enjoy an equally dynamic viewing experience.
- Web-Exclusive Floating Player: Available exclusively on desktop via Google Chrome, this flexible floating window keeps TikTok visible above other windows, allowing you to multitask without missing out on your favorite content.
- New Collections Feature: Organize your favorite videos into custom categories, making it easier to find and revisit saved content.
‚ÄúOur users interact with TikTok in many different ways, which is why we‚Äôre excited to introduce these web app updates,‚Äù said Cody Puckett, TikTok Product Manager. ‚ÄúBy enhancing our desktop capabilities, we aim to bring TikTok‚Äôs handheld magic on desktop, providing an engaging experience with greater flexibility so you can enjoy TikTok anytime, anywhere. As TikTok evolves, we remain committed to innovating for our community and ensuring the platform is accessible for all.‚Äù
MORE: TikTok music dominance is fading as younger users defect
Bruce Houghton is the Founder and Editor of Hypebot, a Senior Advisor at Bandsintown, a Berklee College Of Music professor and founder of the Skyline Artists Agency

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: Customer's photo of forlorn owner in empty restaurant leads business to boom at OK diner Nick Chappell had never been to Spirals Hot Dogs & More before he took a photo of Scott Festler in his empty restaurant. But after business boomed, Chappell's part of the Spirals family, Festler says. [Anthony Robledo](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7612431001/anthony-robledo/) An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for. During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Festler standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Festler would soon have no time to stand around as " [Spirals: Hot Dogs & More](https://spiralshotdogs.com/)," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral. "We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Festler told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me." The day the photo was taken, Festler found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Festler said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down. Festler wouldn't hear of it. "You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': [See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her](/story/life/humankind/2023/12/26/dolly-parton-meets-longtime-fan/72033945007/) Customer knew he had to capture 'wholesome moment' Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance. Noticing Festler gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in." "A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said. In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Festler waiting for diners. Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit. "I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post." Owner adds new 'Thunderbird' item in customer's honor Festler is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so. The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalape√±os, Festler said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of. The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact. Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family. "To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesn‚Äôt have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Festler added.

author: Daniela Aguayo
title: Ola de Calor en Chile: Se pronostican hasta 35¬∞C en 7 regiones del pa√≠s
text:
Conoce a continuaci√≥n el pron√≥stico del tiempo para las zonas afectadas por altas temperaturas.
Comienza un nuevo a√±o y consigo, una [nueva temporada de altas temperaturas](https://www.lacuarta.com/temas/clima/) provocadas por la llegada del verano.
Y si bien en este primer mes del 2025 se suelen registrar temperaturas que rondan los 30¬∞C, meteor√≥logos pronostican para estos primeros d√≠as de enero una ola de calor en siete regiones del pa√≠s que podr√≠an superar los 35¬∞C.
Seg√∫n los expertos, cuando las temperaturas superan el l√≠mite pronosticado por tres d√≠as consecutivos, se considera ola de calor, evento que se ver√° reflejado estos pr√≥ximos d√≠as.
Ola de calor
Seg√∫n informaci√≥n oficial de la [Direcci√≥n Meteorol√≥gica de Chile (DMC)](https://www.meteochile.gob.cl/PortalDMC-web/index.xhtml), las temperaturas para estos primeros d√≠as del a√±o estar√°n m√°s altas de lo normal en las regiones de Coquimbo, Valpara√≠so, Metropolitana, O‚ÄôHiggins, Maule, √ëuble y B√≠o B√≠o.
As√≠, a partir de este jueves 2 hasta el domingo 5 de enero, se esperan temperaturas m√°ximas entre los 34¬∞C y 35¬∞C en estas siete regiones, espec√≠ficamente en las zonas de la Cordillera de la Costa, Valle y Precordillera.
Pero a pesar de que la alerta de altas temperaturas registran los 35¬∞C, Meteored afirm√≥ que los term√≥metros podr√≠an incluso alcanzar los 37¬∞C.
Frente a este fen√≥meno, se hace el llamado a utilizar protecci√≥n solar y cuidarse de los rayos UV que pueden provocar quemaduras y efectos adversos en la piel ante la constante exposici√≥n.

author: Beth Slovic | BSlovic@oregonian.com
title: 2 skiers stranded on South Sister whisked to safety by Black Hawk helicopter
text:
Rescuers with the Oregon Army National Guard ferried two skiers stranded on South Sister to safety on Tuesday.
The skiers, 19- and 20-year-old men from Salt Lake City, needed help after one of the pair injured himself on the 10,358-foot mountain, according to the Deschutes County Sheriff‚Äôs Office.
The sheriff‚Äôs office was the first to deploy rescuers, but it was a Black Hawk helicopter from the National Guard that picked up the skiers and took them to St. Charles Medical Center in Bend, the sheriff‚Äôs office said.

author: Redacci√≥n Animal Pol√≠tico
title: AMLO destaca trayectoria de Luisa Mar√≠a Alcalde; dice estar a favor del m√©todo de encuesta para elegir dirigencia de Morena
text: El presidente Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador elogi√≥ a la secretaria de Gobernaci√≥n, Luisa Mar√≠a Alcalde , luego de que manifestara su intenci√≥n por buscar la presidencia de Morena; aunque dijo no ser objetivo, destac√≥ que ‚Äúha hecho un extraordinario papel todo el tiempo como dirigente‚Äù. ‚ÄúEn el caso de Luisa, pues no soy objetivo. Imag√≠nense que estuvo de joven, hasta la cuestionaban, est√°bamos empezando, organiz√≥ a los j√≥venes, ella y otras compa√±eras y compa√±eros (‚Ä¶) que conste que no es propaganda, todos tienen derecho a participar, pero ya que me preguntan, yo doy mi opini√≥n‚Äù. ‚ÄúLa invit√© a ser secretaria del Trabajo, bien, y secretaria de Gobernaci√≥n, muy bien. Pero quien va a decidir es Morena. A lo mejor ya no voy a estar aqu√≠ cuando hagan la elecci√≥n, quien va a decidir es la militancia, los ciudadanos‚Äù, dijo. El mandatario destac√≥ que como diputada federal, en la primera legislatura de Morena en la C√°mara de Diputados, Alcalde se opuso a la privatizaci√≥n de las playas del pa√≠s que promov√≠an el PRI y el PAN. Durante su conferencia matutina aprovech√≥ para transmitir un promocional de Morena de 2012, donde Alcalde particip√≥ cuando el partido iniciaba. üî¥ [@lopezobrador_]se pronunci√≥ sobre el relevo en la dirigencia de [@PartidoMorenaMx]y habl√≥ de [@LuisaAlcalde]: ‚Äúno soy objetivo [‚Ä¶] ha hecho un extraordinario papel todo el tiempo‚Äù. El presidente dijo que le decisi√≥n recaer√° en la militancia y la ciudadan√≠a. [pic.twitter.com/8ifNRCKv8o] ‚Äî Animal Pol√≠tico (@Pajaropolitico) [July 11, 2024] L√≥pez Obrador sostuvo que ‚Äútodos tienen derecho a participar‚Äù en el proceso democr√°tico de un partido. Se√±al√≥ que la actual secretaria general de Morena, Citlalli Hern√°ndez , tambi√©n ha hecho un buen trabajo. Asimismo, se pronunci√≥ por aplicar el m√©todo de la encuesta para elegir a la nueva dirigencia, al considerar que de esta manera se evitan choques, conflictos y divisiones; adem√°s se evita la tentaci√≥n del acarreo en una elecci√≥n abierta. Mario Delgado, actual presidente del partido, deber√° dejar su cargo en octubre.

author: Austin Trunick
title: Interview: Dolph Lundgren on Skin Trade & Fighting Human Trafficking | Under the Radar Magazine
text: Bruce Lee was trying to fight sex trafficking of American women in ‚ÄúEnter the Dragon‚Äù. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8PGjCWpbt4U](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8PGjCWpbt4U) So Dolph is trying to carry on Bruce‚Äôs legacy. In every showing of this film - there has been parts of it edited about sex trafficking. Watch the WHOLE unedited version from Netflix and you‚Äôll see what I mean. Dolph Lundgren Discusses His Latest Film, ‚ÄúSkin Trade‚Äù The Action Star On His New Movie and His Efforts to Help Fight Human Trafficking May 08, 2015 [Dolph Lundgren](https://www.undertheradarmag.com/issues/dolph_lundgren) In Skin Trade, Dolph Lundgren plays American cop Nick Cassidy, who travels to Bangkok to take down a sex trafficking syndicate run by a violent crime lord. While there on his revenge mission, Nick‚Äôs efforts become entangled with those of an undercover detective played by martial arts star Tony Jaa. It‚Äôs an action-packed film with a supporting cast of cool, cult actors, including Ron Perlman, Peter Weller, and Michael Jai White. Dolph Lundgren began his acting career with a small role in the 1985 James Bond movie, A View To A Kill. Standing at a muscular 6‚Äô5‚Äù, Lundgren was a formidable on-screen presence. His second film would be his breakthrough: Lundgren was cast as Ivan Drago, the imposing Soviet fighter who exchanges blows with Sylvester Stallone in Rocky IV. The rookie actor‚Äôs career exploded. He became an action film staple and an icon of the genre, with starring roles in films such as Universal Soldier, Masters of the Universe, and The Expendables. Since the turn of the century, Lundgren has found work behind the camera, as well. Lundgren is not only the star of his latest film, Skin Trade, but writer and producer. We chatted with Lundgren about his new movie and his personal efforts to help fight human trafficking. Austin Trunick [Under the Radar]: A lot of people are going to look at this film just as an action movie, but it‚Äôs dealing with subject matter that seems important to you. Was part of the reason you made Skin Trade to raise awareness of sex trafficking? Dolph Lundgren: I got really interested in the subject matter. Even before the movie started, I started looking around for ways to help. I finally found this organization in L.A. that I‚Äôm working with now called CAST [The Coalition to Abolish Slavery & Trafficking]. They help a lot of survivors, and to rescue people from human trafficking and sex trafficking, and then they help them to work their way back into society here in America. Hopefully I can do more things in the future, as well. Can you tell me about the work you‚Äôre doing with CAST? I‚Äôve only worked with them for six or seven months now, but I help them raise money and help raise awareness. There are events I‚Äôm going to where funds are being raised for [fighting] human trafficking, amongst other things. On the 21st of May, a premiere of Skin Trade is being done to support CAST and their human trafficking efforts. There‚Äôs another thing called BLUEcause, where people can bid on doing activities with celebrities, and I auction workouts. [Laughs] That money is going to CAST. So, that‚Äôs kind of what I do. You were inspired to write this story by a newspaper article you read about human trafficking. Yeah. I read an article about girls who were being trafficked from Mexico to the U.S., and they were left at the border by the traffickers. They died in this van, from heat exhaustion and suffocation. There was a similar incident in Thailand, as well. So, yeah, that was part of the inspiration for the script. How long did the idea dwell inside your head before you started writing a story around it? I had it for a couple of years. I did a three-act structure, and then I did the screenplay‚Äîthis is way back, like six, seven, or eight years ago. The screenplay had various locations. For a while I was going to shoot in Russia, and I was over there in Moscow, looking for locations, financing, and actors, and so forth. That didn‚Äôt work out, so then I was in Southeast Asia a couple years back working on something else. I ran into somebody who was interested in financing the movie, and so I switched it to Southeast Asia. I imagine that‚Äôs where Tony Jaa came in. Yes, that‚Äôs correct. Tony‚Äôs a big star in Asia, but here in the U.S. he‚Äôs still only really known by more hardcore action and martial arts movie fans. Do you feel he‚Äôs overdue for a breakthrough with U.S. audiences? He feels that way. [Laughs] He‚Äôs a talented, very interesting guy. I think he could play more dramatic roles, too. He really wants to feature his fighting abilities, but if you look at Bruce Lee, Jackie Chan, and Jet Li, those stars‚Äîthey‚Äôve got this charisma that you need. The fighting isn‚Äôt enough. I think he has that, and we brought some of that out in this movie. You see some of it, but I think he can do even better. So yeah, I think he could break through. Were you a fan of his Thai films before working on this project? I hadn‚Äôt seen any of them. I watched some of them because I was over there working on another film, and I was made aware of him. He‚Äôs a really great fighter, and it‚Äôs unusual these days to do your own stunts the way he does. And, you know, he has personality. But I did see many of them after that: Ong Bak, The Protector‚Ä¶ They‚Äôre pretty cool. Your supporting cast has Ron Perlman, Peter Weller, and Michael Jai White‚Äîit‚Äôs a cool group of actors. Did you have input in the casting? Yes, I did. We went through a lot of different names, but what was cool is that people responded fairly well to the material. Ron [Perlman] was great. And also, he‚Äôs a big guy, so physically he looks formidable. Jai, of course‚Äîhe‚Äôs also a great fighter. And Peter Weller came in late, but he turned out to be a great addition. I loved working with him. He‚Äôs such a great actor. He‚Äôs one of those oldschool guys, like Chris Walken‚Äîwhere everything he does is interesting. You mentioned that Ron Perlman‚Äôs a big guy. Has that been an obstacle for you in your career‚Äîfinding co-stars who are big enough to look like they could realistically take you on? Yeah! It has, for sure. And if I‚Äôm playing the lead, who do I make the bad guy, you know? And for some reason a lot of actors tend to be short. I don‚Äôt know why. It‚Äôs the classic sort of John Wayne syndrome. In all the old John Wayne movies he‚Äôd have the same guys a lot, like Victor McLaglen. He used to fight the same guy all the time. He was a big guy. He had leading ladies who were fairly tall, to make it look more normal. He was 6‚Äô4‚Äù, I think. A lot of the old stars were really tall; like Robert Mitchum, those guys. In Skin Trade, you have a long, drawn-out, choreographed fight with Tony. How long did you spend working through those scenes together? It took a long time. They worked on it for a month or two before I got there, and then it all changed ‚Ä¶ Tony and me, we started working on it together. I think Tony and I worked on it for maybe two weeks, and then we shot it over a week. I learned a lot about how to put these things together. You have to be on top of everything. I know these are carefully choreographed, but I‚Äôm wondering how much freedom you have when you‚Äôre the actors doing these fights to come up with your own moves and ideas? We had a lot of freedom. You know, because I was a producer. I think what we try to do with the director is tell a story within the fight, so it‚Äôs not all just mindless punches and kicks. I think in a less sophisticated movie they‚Äôll just fight forever, on this rooftop, that rooftop, the street, on the bus‚ÄîI mean, it‚Äôs okay to do that in a comedy, or whatever. But in a real fight? That‚Äôs why the Rocky movies are great: there‚Äôs a story within the fights. Who wins, who‚Äôs on top at the beginning, and then this changes, and then that one gets injured and the other one takes over; there‚Äôs a beginning, middle, and an end to every fight. That‚Äôs what you need. You need to figure that out before you throw the moves in there. I know you and Tony are both professionals when it comes to shooting action scenes, but how battered do you feel after something like that? How long does it take you to recover from shooting a movie with this much action? You get beat up. You get hit, you fall‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre basically tired. Your muscles are tired. Yeah, you need recovery time. It took me a week to get over it after that fight. You get cut and things get infected because you‚Äôre in the tropics‚Äîit‚Äôs not easy. Fortunately I‚Äôve done a lot of fights in my career. We wanted people to see me and Tony do a lot of stuff ourselves, but you pay a price. For sure. You shot most of the film in Bangkok. When you‚Äôre shooting movies abroad, do you take time to get out and see stuff when you‚Äôre not working? Pretty much everywhere I go, I make it my business to arrange a tour with a guide‚Äîat least for one day‚Äîto learn the history of the place and see the monuments and famous buildings. I like history, you know? I did that in Bangkok early on, but I do it every other place I go, too. You had such a hand in driving Skin Trade, from writing it, to producing it, to eventually starring in it. Do you have more projects lined up like this one, which are more personal for you? Yeah. I learned a lot from this picture: what to do, what not to do. You know, I have projects where I just act, that are more like work. I play characters and have fun doing it, but it‚Äôs like a gig for hire. And then I have things where I‚Äôm more involved. For instance, I have a project that‚Äôs a WWI picture. It‚Äôs set in 1917, in Europe. I‚Äôm from Europe, and I haven‚Äôt done much there. I probably haven‚Äôt done anything in Sweden at all. It‚Äôs a script I‚Äôve had for probably 10 years, but for some reasons it couldn‚Äôt get made and I couldn‚Äôt get the rights, but now I‚Äôm close to getting it made. We‚Äôre working on a script re-write right now. That‚Äôs something I would direct, as well, and have a little more control than I did on Skin Trade. But, yeah, that‚Äôs something I‚Äôm really looking forward to doing, because I like the story and, obviously, it‚Äôs set in Sweden and Germany and on the Western Front. It should be cool. Not too long ago you put out a fitness book titled Train Like An Action Hero. Obviously we‚Äôll need to read the book to get the whole routine, but do you have any quick tips to share? [Laughs] Well, I think fitness isn‚Äôt about a diet, or a quick fix. It‚Äôs a lifestyle. It‚Äôs how you think ‚Ä¶ It takes a lifetime effort. People are into these big fads, you know, great abs in 20 minutes. But it‚Äôs better adopt a level where you feel comfortable, and it feels easy, and then try to build a little bit and stick with it. I think it‚Äôs the fact that it takes a long time that people find hard to accept, but that‚Äôs how it is. *** Skin Trade is now in theaters and available on demand. For more information about the film, [check out its website](http://www.magnetreleasing.com/skintrade/). You can learn more about CAST [at their website](http://www.castla.org/homepage). Comments Submit your comment [Jody Williams](http://www.sexworkersanonymous.com) February 27th 2016 6:04pm Bruce Lee was trying to fight sex trafficking of American women in ‚ÄúEnter the Dragon‚Äù. [Virtual Private Server](https://alexhost.com/virtual-server.html) March 13th 2017 9:55am In the new action flick SKIN TRADE, Dolph Lundgren and Tony Jaa co-star as two detectives fighting to take down and get revenge on a human trafficking. author: Curex
title: Curex Revolutionizing Allergy Immunotherapy with Telehealth
text: New York,NY, Dec. 28, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Allergy sufferers looking to treat their allergies without the pain and inconvenience of weekly visits to their doctor now have an ally in an at-home allergy offering developed by Curex. Online allergy clinic, Curex, is transforming how allergies are treated in the US with its affordable convenient alternative to allergy shots. Allergy immunotherapy is a proven approach to treating allergies, offering the promise of long-lasting relief. In contrast to traditional allergy medication that focus merely on alleviating symptoms, immunotherapy aims to tackle the root cause of allergies by desensitizing the body to specific allergens. However, conventional allergy immunotherapy often involves frequent in-person visits to an allergist's office, adding a time-consuming and inconvenient aspect to the treatment. Studies have shown that up to 75% of allergy sufferers discontinue allergy shots due to these challenges. But now, there is a better way. Curex offers an improved method of desensitization from allergies through its safe, effective, and convenient at-home alternative to traditional allergy shots. Curex's [allergy immunotherapy](https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=O1IKkwkyVPs4aADCyZm4JyV58_Sf2yej5SKBCqjm3QyPnhrIRX_6OdC1reynQQAM_wHpYhDH1UIfx7SZxaHGDANi4R7TrFyaZx5nUo0bVDM=) treatment ensures long-term relief and includes the same composition as allergy shots, with the sole distinction being that it's administered sublingually (under the tongue). Moreover, Curex is competitively priced, with an average cost 62% lower than that of shots. Curex accepts major insurance plans and offers a self-pay option as well. The convenience of this approach results in three times better adherence to the treatment, and Curex anticipates that this will eventually yield significantly improved outcomes compared to allergy shots. Allergy sufferers seeking relief through Curex must first share some details about their symptoms, allowing Curex‚Äôs doctors to facilitate an allergy test. Most people can undergo testing conveniently at home, either with the assistance of a medical professional who visits them or by using a testing kit shipped to their home for the collection of a small blood sample. Once the lab concludes the test, patients will receive personalized treatment recommendations, including a prescription for allergy immunotherapy. Upon beginning treatment, a pharmacy will formulate personalized sublingual [allergy drops](https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=O1IKkwkyVPs4aADCyZm4Jxg5lmnmFNGrHg8V5JG3e5epEs72OxVYng1cm75CsD99JRsLlyHYvb-78Cdqh4SyahuoNN9r-_M2UXWn4Peld7Y=) for the customer and dispatch them directly to the customer's home. Sublingual immunotherapy is gluten-free and formulated from all-natural clinical-grade allergen extracts. Suitable for adults and children aged 5 years and older, it effectively addresses allergies triggered by pollens, cats, dogs, molds, dust mites, grasses, and weeds. The treatment is versatile, allowing administration anywhere, and optimal results are achieved through consistent usage. [Curex](https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=VXnHO291n1zft74cFA-5Rjj0gmkLFUZ1tFaTysqDqjlnv3H_PyPNFhGhyXHzoALAxvC0KxoyS7Vr05iNlhNYuZ0CrNKQCWKj_6LixVYNVPm4rtOaaJxatq9wQOdeyKdH) was founded by Gene Kakaulin and Charles Jacoby, who both suffer from allergies. Like many allergy sufferers, Charles and Gene were averse to allergy shots. Motivated by their need for a superior alternative, they realized that allergy immunotherapy extended beyond shots. The sublingual immunotherapy program was developed from extensive research and collaboration with pharmacists and allergists. Since then, the company has served over 150,000 satisfied users. Among those customers is Kelly, who suffered from cat allergies. Faced with the challenge of dating a man with a cat, she turned to Curex for relief, envisioning a future with him. Within three months, her symptoms were alleviated, allowing her to interact with the cat without any allergic reactions. Today, they're happily married. Another Curex customer, Lauren, said: "Curex fits my life way more than allergy shots, especially since I travel frequently. I've already noticed an improvement in my symptoms compared to where I started, and it's a relief not to be on any allergy medications for once." In the spirit of transformative relief, Curex continues to redefine allergy management, providing solutions that resonate with individuals like Kelly and Lauren, fostering not just symptom alleviation but the creation of fulfilling, allergy-free lives. For more information about Curex, visit [getcurex.com](https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=jRD0bVvPrweNb3kR_ZVkzZ7KCQtrecIydCOTCGB5bUAtP0cCiPHy2ddYtdQcdBUDsM90GBFjE4Z75FiWvOHn9g==). Website URL: [getcurex.com](https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=jRD0bVvPrweNb3kR_ZVkzb5lZMeya0BrV1K0iJrTRAdRMvG0hKYFBbIz8143qDaSaz07ZnfxPiVH4YbwXgbdJg==)

Lt. Sean Ianno and family on the Alamodome‚Äôs football field following a University of Texas at San Antonio (UTSA) football game‚Äôs halftime oath of enlistment ceremony. Lt.
